alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Rock Island, northwestern Louisa, southwestern Cedar, southeastern Johnson, east central Washington and western Muscatine Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cotter, or near Columbus Junction, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Conesville around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Letts, Nichols and West Liberty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Iowa.
